intro: Centaurium calycosum, commonly known as the narrow-leaved centaury, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the family Gentianaceae and typically grows in meadows, grasslands, and rocky areas. The plant features slender, erect stems with opposite, linear to lance-shaped leaves. Its small, bright yellow flowers are clustered in dense, spike-like inflorescences. Centaurium calycosum is often found in moist or slightly shaded environments, and it blooms from late spring to early summer.
